Second brain

Last updated on November 8, 2022

My second brain is a large collection of plain text files that I maintain as a repository for things I would like to retrieve later but donâ€™t want to remember now. The public part of it can be found on this website, my digital garden.

â€œSecond brainâ€ is just a nifty new term for a concept thatâ€™s been around for ages: the commonplace book, and later â€” I fantasize about Wall Street in the 90s with Filofax when I hear this term â€” personal information management. These days, thereâ€™s a lot of talk online about personal knowledge management, but frankly, that term irks me a bit. It feels like people everywhere, including those with little original writing, have coopted the term from academics, and that makes me cringe. Nevertheless, here I am.

Tools

Itâ€™s important for me to remember Tools donâ€™t matter. The only thing that matters about a tool is that it must allow me to manipulate plain text or Markdown files that exist in a folder that I can move around freely.

Zinzy Waleson Geene (she/ they) is a researcher, designer, and queer facilitator from Amsterdam. She's interested in humanities and behavioral sciences, yoga practice, and amateur cooking. She engages in mellow cultural and critical analysis, linking and tinkering on her personal website, zinzy.website .
